festival.introText:
In It Together is a festival, a community, and a celebration of music, arts and culture.

Multi genre-spanning festival In It Together (26-28 May 2023) – Wales’ biggest and best festival – has announced its incredible first wave of artists for its second edition next summer.

 

The family friendly festival is returning to Old Park Farm, Margam in May 2023 with an impressive set of star-studded acts and experiences to make it the ultimate weekend of jam-packed fun to remember!

 

Expect a weekend party like no other, filled with incredible music acts, a huge amount of family fun, and memories to last a lifetime. The family camping weekender, which will welcome up to 40,000 people to Port Talbot, is the biggest festival of its kind in Wales. As well as welcoming international superstars to the Welsh valleys, the festival will also support over 50 Welsh artists as it showcases the country’s finest exports.  

 

Your 2023 line up just got better with Parc Stage Headliners The Kooks, Anne-Marie and James taking centre stage across the weekend alongside Groove Armada (DJ SET) on Panchaia, Hedex, Friction, Kettama on Steelworks and Dream State on The Paddock. PLUS more names still to be announced!

 

The Parc stage will take centre stage with a performance from the incredible Grammy nominated Kelis. From the legendary Milkshake to head bopper Trick Me, the American singer-songwriter’s set will be one of the highlights of the weekend. Platinum selling British DJ Tom Zanetti will attract the crowds with his hugely popular hits including Darlin and You Want Me. 

 

Scottish rock band Twin Atlantic also join the main stage line-up and will delight crowds with hit after hit ahead of the headliner acts. Brit award-winning singer-songwriters James Bay and Jake Bugg join the stellar line up alongside hip-hop group and Welsh icons Goldie Lookin Chain, British Tik Tok sensation Tyrone and hugely popular street dance troupe Diversity. Keep your eyes peeled as headliners for the main stage will be announced in the next few months!

 

The worlds of tech house, dance and drum and bass will collide once again at the festival’s iconic Panchaia dance tent. Electronic music duo Chase and Status take the top spot on Sunday evening, signalling the end of an epic weekend with a set full of drum and bass bangers whilst the Saturday night dance tent headliner will be announced in the coming months.

 

Other highlight acts for Panchaia include creators of the iconic Lola’s Theme, The Shapeshifters, Lovely Laura and Ben Santiago and Bou. 

 

Looking for some 90s to noughties nostalgia? Rewind arena is a brand-new edition to the festival for 2023. Expect garage classics from Luck & Neat, Artful Dodger and So Solid Crew, mixed with trance favourites N Trance and Ultrabeat. If that wasn’t enough, on Sunday Rewind will showcase the best in pop and RNB with sets from S Club, Louise Redknapp and Big Brovaz & Booty Luv.

 

The Paddock stage is a welcome edition for local talent as it returns to the festival to host bands and artists playing in both English and Welsh. Curated in conjunction with BBC Horizons and Focus Wales, it promises to showcase the best of the best in upcoming talent. 

 

Representing North Wales and headlining the Saturday evening on The Paddock is alternative indie rock band Joy Formidable whilst garage punk four-piece Goa Express will close the stage on Sunday evening. 

 

There will be even more opportunities for home grown talent in 2023 with the addition of Steelworks, and a new outdoor stage focusing on the best in local underground bands and electronic dance music.

 

The fun doesn’t stop there as the hugely popular Tic Tac Toe area returns for 2023. The ultimate family destination, it’s no exaggeration to say that In It Together really does have something for everyone. Pleasing children and big kids alike, festival goers can spend the day on the world’s biggest bouncy castle and fairground before relaxing at the outdoor cinema.

 

It wouldn’t be In It Together without The Wonky Lizard. Located in the family area, it is the epitome of immersive and interactive entertainment. Headlining Saturday evening and returning to the festival is legendary DJ and radio presenter Craig Charles with a dance busting Funk and Soul set. Throughout the weekend, expect a stage programmed with a unique blend of live music, comedy and cabaret for the whole family to enjoy.

 

For festival goers looking for a bit of down time amongst the chaos, The Retreat is the place to be. From yoga, meditation and mindfulness to massage, reiki and reflexology there’s a relaxing activity for all. 

 

Speaking about this year's festival Mark Hopkins, Head of Festivals said: ‘‘We can’t wait for this year’s festival, we built the excitement with our inaugural festival in 2022 we’re thrilled to be back for 2023 with even more stages, activities and an incredible line up to match. Stay tuned as we’ve got even more to announce between now and the festival!”

 

Tickets for In It Together go on sale 10am, Friday 7 October 2022. Customers who have pre-registered will be able to purchase from 9am, Friday 7 October 2022 – only 1000 second release tickets will be available. Ticket prices start from £139 for a weekend camping ticket or £299 for family tickets (2 adults, 2 children and up to 4 grandparents). Customers can pay as little as £20 deposit and spread the cost over 6 months or pay in full to get Early Access and Thursday Campers party entry for FREE!
festival.descriptionText: Skiddle is an official ticket outlet of In It Together Festival 2023. Get In It Together Festival tickets, news and information with Skiddle.com
festival.location: Old Park Farm Margam in Port Talbot

artists.name: Tom Auton and The Bottle Breakers

reviews.title: Review of In It Together
reviews.body:
thought the main stage was well positioned with the gradient of the hill.
enjoyed the dance tent. maybe have the fair rides further away from the escape and paddock stage as the different music merging was a little irritating.
hopefully have the water situation sorted for next year. have the water taps working to be able to refill water bottles and on the camp site.
could have more food vendors on the camping side. Saturday morning was ridiculous queuing for drinks and food.
communication with campers could be better. when the main stage was closed, no one knew what was happening. wifi network needs to be looked at. not very good reception. was impossible to view social Media to understand what was happening on Saturday as advised.
parking was good.
over all thought the festival was positioned on a good site.
all staff were friendly and the whole atmosphere of the festival was great.
impressed with the artists that performed.
disappointed that soul ll soul and editors didn't perform, but that's down to the artist not the festival. can't control the weather!
under the circumstances I think the festival organisers did a great job.
looking forward to next year.

reviews.title: Review of In It Together
reviews.body: A good first year of what has the potential to be an amazing family friendly festival

reviews.title: Review of In It Together
reviews.body: Best weekend Iâ??ve had in a long time

reviews.title: Review of In It Together
reviews.body: It was excellent. Bit of a wait to get into the car park but apart from that, all good

faqs.question: When is In It Together 2023?
faqs.answer: In It Together takes place on Friday 26th to Sunday 28th May 2023. There will also be an exclusive campers party on Thursday 25th May.

faqs.question: Can you camp at In It Together Festival?
faqs.answer: Yes, camping is a big part of the In It Together experience. As well as the usual amenities, the sites have camping convenience stores, a selection of breakfast food traders as well as access to showers, toilets and a dedicated BBQ area. You can also upgrade your camping experience by booking one of the Boutique Camping packages.

faqs.question: What happens if I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent. Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.question: Will there be coaches to In It Together?
faqs.answer:
Big Green Coaches are proud to be the official coach travel provider for In It Together Festival. Choose weekend or day return services from:

  • Bath
  • Birmingham
  • Bridgend
  • Bristol
  • Cardiff
  • Cheltenham
  • Gloucester
  • London
  • Newport
  • Reading
  • Swansea

Seats start from just £20 return.

faqs.question: Accessibility
faqs.answer: In It Together is held at Old Park Farm and as such there is some uneven ground. Whilst every precaution is being made, the weather conditions can dramatically affect the ground conditions so wherever possible please try to consider what preparations you may need to make and equipment you may need to bring along.

faqs.question: Where is In It Together?
faqs.answer: In It Together takes place at Old Park Farm, Water Street, Margam, Port Talbot SA13 2TG and is easily located by car, train or coach.

faqs.question: What time does the campsite open and close?
faqs.answer:
The campsite opens at 9am on Friday 26th May and will close at 12pm on Monday 29th May.

 

There will be an early access add on you can purchase for Thursday entry to the campsite from 12pm. The add on includes an exclusive campers party.

faqs.question: Bookable access facilities
faqs.answer: After significant feedback from In It Together 2022, the festival are working hard behind the scenes to provide improved accessible features within the festival for 2023. As a result, they are currently reworking their Access Requirement form to be more suited in order for them to provide these improved features. Once complete, you will need to pre-book using the Access Requirement form, please email accessibility@escaperecords.co.uk to receive this. This form and the required evidence must be sent to them once you have purchased a ticket.

faqs.question: What is the difference between VIP and General Release?
faqs.answer: Club Miami is their dedicated VIP area and is the perfect way to experience In It Together. You will be given access to the exclusive VIP area which boasts a cocktail bar & upgraded toilets for VIP use only, which also avoids queuing. A viewing garden and a chance to rub shoulders with some of the country’s most influential people. If you’d like to purchase VIP tickets or upgrade and need a little more information and support, please drop an email at vip@escaperecords.co.uk and include your phone number and the VIP team will give you a call to assist.

faqs.question: Can I park at In It Together?
faqs.answer: Yes, there is parking on site. Passes are available at a cost of £20 per vehicle. Please be aware parking will be allocated on a first come first served basis so we recommend booking in advance. The car park will be open from 9am on Friday 3rd June and will close at midday on Monday 6th June.

faqs.question: What are In It Together's opening times?
faqs.answer: The campsite will open at 9am on Friday 26th and will close at Midday on Monday 29th May 2023. The festival site will be open from 11am until 2am on Friday and Saturday and 11am-11pm on Sunday.

faqs.question: Can I upgrade to camping tickets?
faqs.answer: Yes you can please email custcare@skiddle.com who will be able to assist.

faqs.question: Can I reserve my pitch?
faqs.answer: General campsite pitches are allocated on a first come first served basis. However you can purchase a pre-pitched tent in the VIP campsite hosted by Pink Moon. Please visit Pink Moon Camping

faqs.question: 2 for 1 Tickets for Personal Assistant
faqs.answer: There is a 2:1 ticket scheme for individuals who would be unable to attend our events without bringing a personal assistant. Once you have bought a full price ticket, please fill in the access requirement form (email accessibility@escaperecords.co.uk to receive this) and provide a form of evidence as listed on the form to receive your personal assistant ticket.

faqs.question: Can I leave and re-enter In It Together car park?
faqs.answer: There will be two car parks, one for Weekend Camping and one for day visitors. All those with Non Weekend camping will park with the day tickets. Please note you will need to purchase a parking ticket.

faqs.question: What tickets should I purchase if I am staying in a campervan?
faqs.answer: You will need to purchase camping tickets as well as a campervan pitch. You will also need to purchase a parking pass for any towing vehicles.

faqs.question: Can I bring my motorhome or caravan?
faqs.answer:
Yes you can – the allocated pitch size for camper vans and caravans is 8m x 6m. Due to uneven ground in some areas, please take precautions to ensure that your vehicle is securely stationed. Please note for those with caravans and trailer tents, please note that towing vehicles must be removed from the Campsite and parked in the public car park.

 

Please note you must purchase a Motorhome pitch in addition to the cost of your weekend camping tickets.

faqs.question: Are there any age restrictions at In It Together?
faqs.answer:
Can I bring my children?

In It Together is open for all ages. All children under the age of 15 must be accompanied by a responsible adult. Any adult is responsible entirely for the safety and welfare of any Infant and/or Child and/or Teenager in their party. We do not accept any parental or supervisory duty of care or liability for any under 18s on site.

A Challenge 25 policy will be in place on all bars and may be asked to provide evidence of your age with valid photographic ID (Driving License or Passport.)

 

I am under 18, can I attend without an adult?

Yes we have a designated Teen campsite for 16-17 year olds. No alcohol is permitted on this site and strict searches will be conducted.

 

Can I bring my grandparents?

Yes everyone is welcome at In It Together and we want you to bring the grandparents for free!

faqs.question: Accessible Toilets
faqs.answer: There will be a number of accessible toilets located on the festival site and within the campsite.

faqs.question: Can I go back to my car once I'm in the campsite?
faqs.answer: In It Together does not allow pass outs to the car park during the festival. However, you will be allowed multiple trips when unloading / loading your car.

faqs.question: Do motorhomes include electrical hook up?
faqs.answer: Yes all motorhomes include electrical hook up. But please be aware that no hookups are available for water within the Campsite.

faqs.question: Can I bring my own alcohol and food into the main arena?
faqs.answer:
No. You are not allowed to bring your own alcohol or food into the main arena at the festival, this is to only be consumed within the campsite. Bins will be provided at the gates to dispose of any items before entering the main arena.

 

There are several standpipes that contain free, clean drinking water in the campsites and main arena. Please bring a container that you can refill during the weekend. Bottled water will also be available to purchase at the catering units and bars throughout the site. Please identify yourself with these points and ensure you stay hydrated across the weekend.

 

In It Together has a wide variety of food and drink facilities available with various cuisines on offer, there’s something for everyone at this summer’s event.

faqs.question: Accessible Camping Wristband
faqs.answer:
On arrival, there will be an Access Information Point where customers can collect further information on access within the festival site. It is also here that additional pre-agreed wristbands can be collected.

The accessible campsite will be cordoned off from general camping. There will be a number of accessible toilets and showers. Please assist with planning by letting the festival know if you intend to use this service when completing the Access Requirement Form.

Near to the Accessible Campsite there are village services (bar, concessions, information point and welfare).

faqs.question: How far is it from the car park to the campsite?
faqs.answer: The car park is a short walk to the campsite.

faqs.question: Can we have a tent or awning next to our motorhome?
faqs.answer:
In It Together do not allow separate tents to be erected alongside your campervan/ motor homes. However, if you wish to erect an awning, this is possible. You must allow 2m of space between your own awning and your neighbours plot and any awning must fit within your 8m x 6m pitch size.

 

Please note, all awning is erected at the discretion of the campsite manager, and you may be asked to remove it if it deemed obstructive to the surrounding pitches.

faqs.question: Can I bring my own alcohol to In It Together?
faqs.answer:
here is a wide selection of beer, cider, wine and cocktails available across the main arena for you to enjoy during the weekend.

 

If you are camping you are permitted to bring in your own alcohol. When unloading your camping equipment from your car, you are only permitted to bring alcohol in on the FIRST trip, all other attempts to bring in alcohol will not be allowed. Please see below on what you can and can’t bring and thank you for your understanding:

 

You can bring the following into the campsite PER PERSON:

  • EITHER 10 x cans of beer or lager or cider
  • OR 10 premixed spirit cans (max 250ml)
  • OR 1 bottle of wine decanted into a plastic bottle

Please note

  • Strictly no spirits or hard liquor are permitted
  • No glass is permitted on site
  • Searches will be undertaken upon entry to ensure this is complied with
  • Any alcohol above this allocation will be confiscated
  • This alcohol may only be consumed within the campsite
  • Sealed bottles of water and soft drinks are allowed, but will be checked on entry to the site. There will be no limit on soft drinks
  • No pass-outs or readmission will be permitted for the duration of the festival
  • A wide selection of beer, wine and cocktails will be available in the main arena across the weekend

faqs.question: Facilities in the accessibility campsite
faqs.answer:
• Accessible showers and toilets
  • Fresh water points
  • Waste disposal point

faqs.question: Can I park my car and Campervan alongside tents?
faqs.answer: In the general campervan area, cars and campervans will be parked in a designated area and cannot be parked alongside tents.

faqs.question: What time can I get breakfast at In It Together?
faqs.answer: The campsite food stalls will be open from 8AM. There will be a wide range of teas, coffees, smoothies and delicious food to start your day the right way!

faqs.question: Accessible Parking Pass
faqs.answer: An Accessible Car Park is located within the Accessible Campsite perimeter. Customers are allowed to park their cars near their tent in a designated car park, but not directly next to their tent.

faqs.question: Will there be somewhere to charge my phone?
faqs.answer: Yes. Phone charging stations will be available at an additional cost in the campsite at In It Together. You can prebook yours here: https://chargecandy.com/festivals/in-it-together/

faqs.question: Will there be family activities on site?
faqs.answer: Yes we have teamed up with Junior Jungle to provide a daily programme of incredible family activities.

faqs.question: Restricted items
faqs.answer:
The following list is prohibited from In It Together:

Glass items, candles, gas canisters, flares, knives, illegal substances, drugs, ‘legal highs’, laser equipment/pens, megaphones, nitrous oxide, animals, fireworks, smoke canisters, poles, drones, gazebos and any items which in the absolute discretion of the Promoter are considered to be a risk to the safety of the audience and/or affect the enjoyment of the audience and/or the running of the Festival are prohibited.

Everyone will be searched on entry and management reserve the right to confiscate prohibited items.

faqs.question: I have another camping question
faqs.answer: Please see full terms at In It Together here: https://inittogetherfestival.com/info-faq/#date-times

location.address: Oldpark Farm, Old Park Road, Margam

under the circumstances I think the festival organisers did a great job.

reviewsDisplayFour.body: It was excellent. Bit of a wait to get into the car park but apart from that, all good

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of In It Together
reviewsDisplayFour.body: Great first year... there were a few teething problems, but mostly things that were out of the hands of the organisers. Some fantastic performances from some cracking artists, good food, lots of smiling faces, and right on my doorstep. Already looking forward to next year!

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of In It Together
reviewsDisplayFour.body: Location, layout & entry all good.  More info around site would be an improvement but 100% recommended.

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of In It Together
reviewsDisplayFour.body: Absolutely brilliant festival awesome atmosphere and lovely beautiful people excellent music and a beautiful farm setting the absolute best festival xxx . I have already recommended in it together to everyone I know really enjoyed ð?¤©ð???ð???ð???
